newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Gengold says cutting costs key to future.
newsitem.headline: Gengold says cutting costs key to future.

text.p: Higher productivity and improved costs competitiveness were key targets for Gengold, Tom Dale, chairman of Gencor Ltd's gold unit, said on Monday.

In a statement accompanying second quarter results, Dale appealed to management and employees not to the allow the current market gloom to distract their attention from the central issue of reducing dollar-denominated costs per ounce.

Commenting on the new set-up at Evander Gold Mines Ltd, Dale said the unified executive management structure was working well. But given current low gold prices, future production and cost targets would depend to a large degree on progress in current wage negotiations.

South Africa's gold mining industry agreed an outline productivity-linked wage accord with labour earlier this month, the first of its kind. This agreement is now subject to negotiation at a company and mine level.
In the face of a sagging bullion price, Gengold saw its distributable income fall to 60.65 million rand in the quarter to end-June versus 87.70 million in the preceding quarter.
Gold output rose slightly to 10,478 kg from 10,182, despite a dip in average yield to 5.8 grammes per tonne from 5.9 as more ore was milled.
